alert.note: Alert for Chester; York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 2:53PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Cabarrus, Mecklenburg, southeastern Gaston, western Union, northeastern Chester and eastern York Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 252 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles northwest of Uptown Charlotte to 4 miles east of Rock Hill to 5 miles west of Lancaster. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rock Hill, Uptown Charlotte, Huntersville, Downtown Concord, Monroe, Kannapolis, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, Northeast Charlotte and Southwest Charlotte. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
